main.name: Brennan Spicer
main.description: I was taught the MERN stack by some of the best at the University of Minnesota's coding boot camp, and I'm eager to put my new skills to the test in a professional environment
main.bio: Hello there! My name is Brennan Spicer. I am a web developer hailing from the great state of Minnesota, raised in the even greater city of Eagan. I'm a 25 year old college graduate currently living with three longtime friends and our house mascot, Sawyer, the border collie. I'm a tenacious person who takes pride in the work that I do. I will work tirelessly to secure the confidence of those around me and submit work we can all be proud of. I'm always grateful and excited for new opportunities to learn and grow as a developer and a person, and I'm eager to see what awaits me in this beautiful life.
main.contactmessage: Please don't hesitate to reach out if you find yourself interested in what I have to offer.

resume.skillmessage: Self-motivated web developer with considerable experience working with rigorous schedule on multiple projects. Passionate and diligent with penchant for meeting deadlines. Interested in front-end, back-end, or full stack web developer role with company promoting best practices and offering diverse projects.

education.school: University of Minnesota Coding Boot Camp
education.description: Learned the MERN stack and countless invaluable tools for working in the development field. Graduated with an A+ average and high marks on all of my collaborative projects, which you can find below.
Studied liberal arts and did a lot of self-discovery. Learned how to work well with others, take responsibility, and show tenacity regardless of the circumstances.

work.title: CSS Developer
work.description: Began by designing paid custom CSS layouts for multiple subreddits and eventually graduated to implementing custom designs into squarespace websites, enix websites, and more.

work.title: Paraprofessional/Data Manager Extraordinaire
work.description: Created and maintained spreadsheets with extensive formulas and visuals to automate and simplify student data collection and interpretation. Also assisted in recording multiple different data types for numerous students in fifteen-minute increments on daily basis.

projects.title: Password Generator
projects.category: A dynamic password generator that validates and responds to user inputs

projects.title: Spitball
projects.category: A full stack website for collaboratively building ideas, featuring facebook OAuth

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.category: A customizable and automatically updating weather app utilizing multiple API calls

projects.title: The Peace Project
projects.category: A frontend app I built to track progress in recovery

testimonials.text: Brennan and I worked together on a very successful project during our time together in our boot camp. Iâ€™m convinced his brain never stops working as he always seems one step ahead in class and always has an idea or suggestion to solve a problem, be it with JavaScript or React. He seems to always challenge himself by trying to tackle some of the hardest parts [of a project] to make sure that they work perfectly. I can confidently say that our project would not have gone as smoothly as it did without his curiosity and talent.
Killed it! Great work all around, loved the transitions and the code comments. Great job committing frequently and messaging clearly. Keep up the good work!
